headline: Assessing Exxon Mobil’s Current Valuation After Its Big Energy Transition Projects
summary: Wondering if Exxon Mobil at around $115.98 is still a smart buy or if the easy money has already been made? You are not alone in trying to pin down what this giant is really worth today. Despite a modest pullback of 0.6% over the last week and 1.1% over the last month, the stock is still up 8.1% year to date and has delivered a hefty 236.1% over five years. That naturally raises the question of how much of that strength is already priced in. Recent headlines have focused on Exxon Mobil...

headline: JPMorgan expects to spend $105B in 2026, Exxon lifts oil target
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) releasing its 2026 spending forecasts, Exxon Mobil (XOM) lifting its growth targets in earnings, cash flow, and oil production (CL=F, BZ=F), and AutoZone (AZO) stock dropping after reporting a fiscal first quarter earnings miss. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Exxon Finance Chief Kathryn Mikells to Retire in Early 2026
summary: Kathryn Mikells, Exxon Mobil’s chief financial officer, said she plans to retire from the role Feb. 1, citing health concerns.  During a Tuesday investor presentation, Exxon said a non-life threatening health issue led to her decision to leave the company.  Mikells began her role at Exxon in 2021.

headline: Exxon Squeezes More Out of Giant U.S. Oil Field as Rivals Pare Back
summary: Exxon Mobil is using homegrown technology to keep boosting its oil and gas output from the biggest U.S. oil field, defying an industry slowdown.  The U.S. oil company is on track by 2030 to double production to 2.5 million barrels of oil and gas per day in the Permian Basin, it said in an investor presentation Tuesday.  Exxon shares rose nearly 3% in morning trading.

headline: ExxonMobil Raises Its 2030 Plan – Transformation Delivering Higher Earnings, Stronger Cash Flow, and Greater Returns
summary: SPRING, Texas, December 09, 2025--ExxonMobil today updated its Corporate Plan through 2030. The Plan’s increased earnings and cash flow outlook reflects stronger contributions from advantaged assets, a more profitable business mix, and lower operating costs; all driven by the company’s unique set of durable competitive advantages and its successful multi-year transformation.

headline: Heat Transfer Fluids Market Expected to Reach USD 6.3 Billion by 2030
summary: The global heat transfer fluids market is set to grow from USD 5.1 billion in 2025 to USD 6.3 billion by 2030, at a CAGR of 4.3%. Key drivers include rapid industrialization and the rising need for energy efficiency in industries like chemicals, pharmaceuticals, automotive, and HVAC. Synthetic fluids are the fastest-growing segment due to superior thermal stability and safety, while medium-temperature fluids hold a significant market share for their versatility. The industrial processing sector

headline: Asian shares slip after Wall Street pulls back from its record heights
summary: Asian shares mostly fell Tuesday after U.S. stocks pulled away from their record heights, while U.S. futures edged higher.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 index was the main outlier, gaining 0.1% to 50,655.10.  The S&P/ASX 200 in Australia gave up 0.4% to 8,585.90 after the Reserve Bank opted to keep its cash rate unchanged at 3.6%.
